channel.title: Reflection instead of transforming classes
channel.description: Why does it seem more and more people are switching to reflection bots? Is it any better then just using BCEL and Transforming the class?

item.title: Reflection instead of transforming classes
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“shangtsung1, post:29, topic:264262”][quote author=Evil_ link=topic=348979.msg2689285#msg2689285 date=1235867448]
qauters, what language is your bot in?
[/quote]

qauters, what language is your bot written in?

i beleive its in C++[/quote]
It is ;).
Server/Client is c++, update server is java.

item.title: Reflection instead of transforming classes
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

frank_:

MY NAME IS QAUTERS AND I CLAIM THAT BECAUSE I USE REFLECTION, JAGEX CANT REFLECT ON MY OWN CLASSES OR USE THE BCEL THAT SHIPS WITH THE JRE

Reflection is limited to java classes, so Jagex can’t detect my bot (since it’s not written in java =.=)
Reflection is just as detectable as BCEL if used in the same way. In my case this doesn’t apply, therefor my reflection is undetectable.
Which is exactly what I said before.

io9:

MY NAME IS QUATERS AND I THINK THAT ANYONE WHO THINKS OTHERWISE IS RETARDED

I don’t flame for no reason, go to frank_ if you want that. Also try to be original and don’t act the same as frank_.

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection instead of transforming classes
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

I’M SQUIGGYLO AND I’M GOING TO THE POLICE ACADEMY WITH MY HANDI-GIRLFRIEND!

@ontopic

Jagex can, and does, use reflection in their client. Stating that reflection is less detectable is simply foolish.

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection instead of transforming classes
item.dc:creator: @qauters qauters
item.description:
@qauters wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:14, topic:264262”][quote author=qauters link=topic=348979.msg2685778#msg2685778 date=1235671893]

[quote author=frank_ link=topic=348979.msg2684729#msg2684729 date=1235598873]

I use reflection because my bot doesn’t load runescape itself :P. Which makes it impossible to detect (the bot itself, not the behavior!)
[/quote]i heard jagex cant use reflection

What made that phrase usefull?
[/quote]you are retarded[/quote]
No? There are multiple ways to detect besides reflection. Way’s that detect all current bots (reflection/bytecode editing).

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection instead of transforming classes
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

Tenac:

I got reflection working perfect for everything, and even though I could have easily used bcel for everything, I only chose to use reflection because I feel it’s safer since it’s built into java, leechers find it safer, and there aren’t any good reflection bots out there

An example of frank_'s statement…

Read full topic

item.title: Reflection instead of transforming classes
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

frank_:

wat

My thoughts exactly.

I don’t see anything wrong with using BCEL or any other bytecode library for that matter, as long as you are smart about it.
Personally I’d say it’s easier to reflect on a field, than to inject an accessor.

Read full topic
